description: From Middle English mongrel, equivalent to mong (“mixture”) +‎ -rel (pejorative diminutive); from Old English ġemang (“mingling”) (whence Modern English among), from Proto-Germanic *mang- (“mix”).
The raising of /ɔ/ ( → /ɒ/) to /u/ ( → /ʌ/) is regular between /m/ and /ŋ/; compare among, monger.

adjectives.description: mongrel (comparative more mongrel, superlative most mongrel)

entries.meaning: Of mixed breed, nature, or origin; of or like a mongrel.
examples: English spelling is often regarded as confusing and unpredictable due to the mongrel nature of our tongue.

entries.meaning: (often derogatory) Someone or something of mixed kind or uncertain origin, especially a dog.
examples: Synonyms: bitsa, bitser, (UK, Australia, New Zealand) bitzer, cur, mutt, (dialectal) tyke, Heinz 57
That dog is a mongrel; who knows what breed it could be!

entries.meaning: (slang, Australia, New Zealand) A thuggish, obnoxious, or contemptible person; (often preceded by "poor") a pitiable person.
(slang, Australia) An erect penis; an erection.
